conclusion: Analyze the paths of the liquid from points A, B, C, and D to determine which container it will flow into.
Point A: The liquid flows down the black line.
Point A: The liquid follows the white line to the left.
Liquid from point A leads to container E.
Point B: The liquid flows down the brown line.
Point B: The liquid follows the purple line to the right.
Liquid from point B leads to container F.
Point C: The liquid flows down the pink line.
Point C: The liquid follows the orange line to the right.
Liquid from point C leads to container G.
Point D: The liquid flows down the yellow line.
Point D: The liquid follows the gray line to the right.
Liquid from point D leads to container G.
Container E receives liquid from point A.
Container F receives liquid from point B.
Container G receives liquid from points C and D.
Final Answer: Liquid from A flows into container E, from B into F, and from C and D into G.
